title: Luke S. Morris
text:
I’m a small library of contradictions. I started off life in a one-stoplight town in a corner of Kansas and now call Los Angeles home. I spent a decade as a words guy, wrangling wild sentences as a journalist before transforming into a numbers guy, analyzing healthcare data.






A Tender-Loving-Care Volunteer Program to Provide Non-Clinical, Supportive Interventions to Older Adults in the Emergency Department
Annals of Emergency Medicine
Oct. 17, 2022
An Emergency Department-Based Care Coordination Program for Underserved Patients
Academic Emergency Medicine
May 17, 2022
30 Characteristics of Patients Restrained in the Emergency Department and Evaluation for Disparities in Care
Annals of Emergency Medicine
Oct. 22, 2021





Fairly biased: Health equity through a journalism and data science lens
Making the Case for Cedars’ Community Resource Coordinators
Bracketball: Let’s Explore March Madness with ncaahoopR (slides)





Kansas Basketball 2021-22 Season Dashboard (repo)
Predictive Analytics with College Athletics Financials
Examining Article Shareability from Text-Mined Data
